messages.content:
Nicolas - I found the issue! The engines ARE emitting all
  four event types (node.flip, wm.emit, link.flow.summary,
  tick_frame_v1), but there are no WebSocket clients connected
  to receive them.

  The /ws endpoint exists in control_api.py and is mounted on
  the FastAPI app, but I see ZERO connection logs in
  websocket_server.log. This suggests the dashboard frontend
  isn't connecting to ws://localhost:8000/ws.

  Root Cause: The frontend→backend WebSocket connection isn't
  established.

  Next Steps:
  1. Verify dashboard is trying to connect (check browser
  console for WebSocket errors)
  2. Check if CORS/Origin headers are blocking connections
  3. Verify WebSocket URL in frontend code matches backend
